profile.title: Full Stack Developer and AEM Specialist
profile.summary: Results driven engineer with 5 plus years building scalable, responsive web applications across enterprise, fintech, telecom, and healthcare. Deep experience with Adobe Experience Manager for 3 plus years, React, TypeScript, Java Spring Boot, Node.js, and AWS. Strong focus on performance, SEO, CMS, DevOps, and pixel perfect UI from Figma designs.

career_goals: Leverage full stack and AEM expertise to deliver high performing digital experiences, mentor teams, and grow into leadership roles that drive innovation with AI, cloud, and enterprise scale systems.
weaknesses: Taking on too much at once

experience.role: AEM Full Stack Developer and Dev Lead
highlights: Authored AEM pages using client libraries and custom plus built in components
Integrated TypeScript controllers in the Phoenix platform for dynamic UI and backend interaction
Built and tested Node.js REST services and integrated via Phoenix Pub Sub
Designed SEO and analytics which improved visibility and insights
Built a Telemetry page with dynamic binding, reusable components, and shimmer loaders
Used Experience Fragments, Content Fragments, and CA configs for modular content
Managed dispatcher cache and led deployments across local, dev, and QLab
Wrote authoring guides for business users
Unit tests with Jest and collaboration with QA improved reliability
Implemented secure coding with GGShield and GitLab integrations
Maintained Linux based setup on Ubuntu through WSL
Built responsive React UIs inside AEM templates and developed custom AEM components
Integrated AEM Content Services with Spring Boot APIs for dynamic delivery
Created and deployed Spring Boot microservices for React and AEM consumption
Containerized with Docker and deployed on AWS EC2 and Lambda
Set up CI CD with Jenkins and GitLab which reduced time to market
Integrated Grafana and Prometheus for monitoring and reduced downtime
Followed security best practices with role based access and token auth
Delivered React apps that consumed AEM Content Fragments which improved engagement
Integrated Spring Boot REST APIs for backend operations and better performance
Used GraphQL and REST for flexible data retrieval
Unit testing with Jest, Mocha, and JUnit increased reliability
Deployed Docker and Kubernetes workloads for scale
Worked in Agile sprints with Git and Bitbucket for collaboration

experience.company: Tata Consultancy Services for Liberty Mutual
highlights: Developed AEM components and templates integrating Spring Boot through Sling Models
Architected Spring Boot microservices for CMS driven frontends which improved scalability
Implemented IBM ODM decision logic and tested with JUnit to reduce logic errors
Created reusable services for AEM workflows and content rendering
Resolved Jira tickets and delivered on schedule with global teams
Built Java modules for pharmacovigilance platforms and improved data processing speed
Designed PostgreSQL schemas for faster queries
Created D3.js visualizations for better insight
Maintained high uptime with thorough deployment testing using GitLab CI CD

projects_recent: Telemetry page at T Mobile with dynamic binding, reusable components, and shimmer loaders
React UIs integrated with AEM at Freddie Mac for modular content delivery
AEM backed portals with React at University of Cincinnati using Content Fragments

faqs.a: I plan to use my AEM and full stack skills to deliver high performing digital experiences and mentor teams while growing into leadership that pushes innovation in AI and cloud.

faqs.q: Tell me about your leadership experience
faqs.a: I have led delivery at T Mobile by writing authoring guides, coordinating deployments across environments, mentoring teammates, and driving secure coding and testing practices.
Master of Science in Information Technology from the University of Cincinnati with GPA 4.0 and a Bachelor of Technology in Information Technology from JNTU Hyderabad.

faqs.q: What projects have you worked on recently
faqs.a: Recent work includes a Telemetry page with reusable components and shimmer loaders at T Mobile, React plus AEM integrations at Freddie Mac, and AEM backed portals with React at the University of Cincinnati.
